We thought we might have to leave the property to see the eclipse, but a pine needle path led us to the perfect spot. The cabin is as well cared for and sweet as the photos show, and the kitchen has plenty of basic cooking items, plus a large outdoor grill. With such a beautiful view, why go elsewhere? There is another cabin on the property, but it’s thoughtfully laid out so both cabins have privacy and their own outdoor spaces. Hosts David & Luis were quick to communicate and respond whenever we had a question/concern; Luis is local to the area and gave us some wonderful tips for hikes and nature spots. If you love the outdoors and want to drink in some beautiful Adirondack scenery, you should enjoy this place as much as we did. Don't forget to do some star gazing!

review_text:
My husband, daughter and I really enjoyed our time at Riverside Cottage. We were delighted by the gardens on the property, and all of the spaces to enjoy time outside whether it was the fire pit, the screen tent, or the chairs by the river. The setting feels a bit enchanted. My daughter loved wandering around the gardens on this property, as well as John and Lorraine's beautiful garden next door, and playing in the river. We were looking forward to peace and quiet and that is what we got. The sounds of the river were so peaceful and we also enjoyed watching the birds and butterflies from the windows while we ate our meals. The interior of the cottage is very cozy. The surrounding area is nice and the house is close to restaurants and grocery stores. John and Lorraine are wonderful hosts and very communicative throughout the process and went above and beyond to troubleshoot an internet issue we had during our stay. We were greeted with a delicious veggie tray and dip which we had with our dinner our first night. We cooked most of our meals and found the kitchen to be well stocked with pots/pans/utensils as well as pantry basics, and appliances. We recommend visiting the nearby Wilder Homestead if you are fans of the Little House on the Prairie books, and having a meal and ice cream at Bokies.
The only real downside for us was the bed. We knew the rooms came with two twins and a double and while we rarely book anything with a bed smaller than a queen (we have a king bed at home), we felt like everything else about the property made up for the small bed. Ultimately though my husband and I, neither of whom are particularly small, opted to sleep in the twin beds so we could each have enough space to sleep without disturbing each other. We both toss and turn a lot. My husband is 6'1" and found the beds to be just barely long enough for him. Again, we knew exactly what we booked, so the beds were not a surprise and this is about our preference, and is not a ding on the hosts or the listing. The beds are comfortable, just a bit too small for us. If you're extra cuddly sleepers though, this is the place for you! :)
Overall, we really enjoyed our stay and recommend this lovely spot to anyone looking for a comfortable place to relax.

This place is pure paradise, and especially so during the pandemic!!! It is absolutely beautiful, truly, and so peaceful and quiet and relaxing and private and, naturally, totally free of any kind of crowds...the property is just gorgeous, the birds were chirping, there was a breeze in the trees, and oh, that river!!! It's a little more of a babbling brook at that point, and the sound is just delightful and we had fun wading around in the water w our little dog, who was in absolute HEAVEN the ENTIRE time we were there, btw :-)...and, oh! The stars!!!
It was just SO easy to just relax and let all our cares just drift away, and we knew we were in a really safe place, covid-wise, too and that was important. The entire place was even better than we expected and just EXACTLY what we needed!!!!
As for our hosts, Lorraine and John, well...they were just amazing!!!! They were so warm and welcoming and friendly and accommodating and so lovely to talk to...they are very interesting and have interesting stories to tell. They left a welcome plate for us full of delicious veggies from their garden w some of Lorraine's yummy home made dip, and they very kindly brought us some OUTRAGEOUS muffins Lorraine had made bc we actually had some medical and traveling issues before we got there and we were late and so frazzled and they took pity on us... ;-)...AND they showed us their honey bees - so cool!!! They really are WONDERFUL people and hosts!!
The cottage was just so adorable and was furnished just exactly as a home in the country should be...somewhat eclectically w antiques and beautiful wood pieces and cozy bedrooms w comfy beds and beautiful quilts and a wood burning stove, plus everything you need to cook and eat in (instead of going out, which is always a great option, pandemic or not).
There were plenty of places to sit outside, be it by the fire or under the shade canopy or right next to the Salmon River, which runs right through Lorraine and John's property, and we fully enjoyed the sun, the shade, the river, the gorgeous surroundings, the stars...it was truly perfect seriously not an ounce of hyperbole, we promise!!! We had an idea of what we wanted in a little getaway from the city and quarantining and wearing masks all day and simply wanted beauty, peace, and quiet...and we got ALL that and even MORE!!!
Truly, we can't recommend this place, and Lorraine and John, enough - go and ENJOY!!!!
PS - Don't forget to visit the Almanzo Wilder Farm and Homestead, just a short drive away...it was FANTASTIC, and we think even people who AREN'T fans of the Little House on the Prairie books, or don't know much about Laura Ingalls Wilder, will still enjoy a tour and wandering the grounds. and for fans - what a TREAT and an absolute DELIGHT!!!! Call ahead to make sure they're open and to schedule a tour. Fun!!!! :-)

We spent a long weekend at this great location. The apartment is gorgeous and large. While it was just my husband and I, it would be fabulous for a family or even extended family. We enjoyed preparing several meals in the nicely appointed kitchen. After a day of exploring waterfalls, trails and other sights, we enjoyed putting our feet up in the comfortable living room to watch tv or use the excellent WiFi to update family and friends with the day’s activities. We used the North Bangor/Malone location as a jumping off point for multiple day trips exploring upper the Lake Champlain area, the Saint Lawrence River and various locations in the Adirondack Park.
